description.narrative: Strengthened capacity of Government partners to identify, recognize and measure child poverty and use evidence to design, implement, monitor and resource relevant plans., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, girls and boys, particularly the most disadvantaged and excluded, benefit from more equitable and inclusive poverty reduction and social protection systems, policies and programmes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of Government partners to identify, recognize and measure child poverty and use evidence to design, implement, monitor and resource relevant plans.

description.narrative: In 2020, national level government and academia partners strengthened their capacity to understand multidimensional child poverty, distinguish child poverty from adult poverty, and measure MDP. As the GOC moves toward new rationale and approaches to poverty measurement, including for child poverty, UNICEF continuously invested in knowledge generation, facilitated learning and targeted exchanges, supported technical and policy dialogues on child poverty, and participated in international policy discussions. These efforts are expected to help national partners make informed decisions on prioritizing child poverty in the policy agenda. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021

title.narrative: Number of major events and knowledge products on child poverty with national, sub-national government and think-tanks completed and disseminated(45265)
